poem:
**Trade Winds**

In the Oval Office, the winds of change  
whisper through papers, rustling maps,  
as letters flutter, scattering tariffs  
like leaves across the nations' lawns.  
A unilateral breeze, bold and brisk,  
claims it's far too crowded to dance  
with every partner, a solo waltz  
in the global ballroom of commerce.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Trump says US will unilaterally set new tariff rates for scores of countries Donald Trump has said the US will send letters to some of its trading partners to unilaterally impose new tariff rates, suggesting that Washington lacks the capacity to reach individual trade deals. Highlighting the challenge for the White House to negotiate deals with scores of countries at once, Trump said it was “not possible to meet the number of people that want". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
